description: A String. Is it a customer facing or resource facing service.
A String. Free-text description of the service.
A DateTime. Date when the service ends.
A Feature. A list of feature associated with this service.
A Boolean. If TRUE
column3: this Service has already been started.

description: A String. Hyperlink reference.
A String. Unique identifier.
A Boolean. If true
column3: the service is a ServiceBundle which regroup a service hierarchy. If false
column4: the service is a 'atomic' service (hierarchy leaf).

description: A Boolean. If FALSE and hasStarted is FALSE
column3: this particular Service has NOT been enabled for use - if FALSE and hasStarted is TRUE then the service has failed.

description: A Boolean. If TRUE
column3: this Service can be changed without affecting any other services.

description: A String. Name of the service.
A Note. A list of notes made on this service.
A RelatedPlaceRefOrValue. A list of places (Place [*]). Used to define a place useful for the service (for example a geographical place where the service is installed).
A RelatedEntityRefOrValue. A list of related entity in relationship with this service.
A RelatedParty. A list of related party references (RelatedParty [*]). A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.
A Characteristic. A list of characteristics that characterize this service (ServiceCharacteristic [*]).
A String. Date when the service was created (whatever its status).
A RelatedServiceOrderItem. A list of service order items related to this service.
A ServiceRelationship. A list of service relationships (ServiceRelationship [*]). Describes links with other service(s) in the inventory.
A ServiceSpecificationRef.
A String. Business type of the service.
A DateTime. Date when the service starts.
A String. This attribute is an enumerated integer that indicates how the Service is started
column3: such as: 0: Unknown; 1: Automatically by the managed environment; 2: Automatically by the owning device; 3: Manually by the Provider of the Service; 4: Manually by a Customer of the Provider; 5: Any of the above.

description: A ServiceStateType.
A ResourceRef. A list of supporting resources (SupportingResource [*]). Note: only Service of type RFS can be associated with Resources.
A ServiceRefOrValue. A list of supporting services (SupportingService [*]). A collection of services that support this service (bundling
